intro: Hieracium inflexipes, commonly known as the bent-stem hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, oval-shaped achenes as seeds. Hieracium inflexipes is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
